programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 2
programme.desc: After spending 2 days in Mykonos, where food was at the centre of our attention, we are finally on board and sailing towards Tinos. However, we encounter some problems and have to head back to Mykonos, and we take the time to meet the Mayor before heading back into the water.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Ghibellina cruises through to Season 3 of the Voyage of the Ghibellina. As usual, we start our journey in the port of Viareggio. This time however, we will be heading towards southern Italy. Our first stop is Ustica, the small volcanic island to the north of Sicily. We are on a mission to discover the capital of Sicily, Palermo, and explore its rich and diverse history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: This time, we set sail to see the beautiful city of Trapani, a city that has always been closely connected to the sea. One of the most clear signs of the city's connection to the sea is its fish market, here we can find all kind of fishes from the area and get a better sense of the local cuisine. Ghibellina is also setting course to the Aegadian Islands and towards the island of Favignana.

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1 Departure
programme.desc: In the 2013 edition of the The 'Transat Jacques Vabre' the multihulls and monohulls start at Le Havre and are set to arrive to Itajai in Brazil. For even a shot at victory in this extreme test of endurance and maritime skill, each team must find a way to maintain a world class sailing performance all while living together under excruciating conditions.Watch the departure and start of the Transat Jacques Vabre 2013, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2 Arrival
programme.desc: The multihulls and monohulls are competing to the extreme in order to arrive in first place at Itajai in Brazil. After the non-stop 5,450 nautical mile course from France to Brazil, the skippers see the bright light ahead and rush towards Brazilian shores. What team will be the ultimate winner of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre? Find out on the 2013 edition of this transatlantic ocean competition.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 3
programme.desc: On this episode, we are going to check out the Surf at Lisbon Film Fest in Portugal. Lisbon has a lot more to offer than just world-class waves, and we are ready to dive into the film action. Come join us as we visit this important surfing festival and take a close look behind the scenes!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 4
programme.desc: In today's episode of Screen Heroes we land in France. Before we check out the 10th edition of the International Surf Film Festival in Anglet we will be taking a closer look at this beautiful region. In the first win of the festival, Garrett Mcnamara's search for the world's biggest wave in Nazare has left us mesmerized. Will the rest of the movies cause the same impact?

This event involves high-speed watercraft racing action, and competitors face each other against the clock to determine this season's ultimate winner. Start your engines and come race with us!

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 1
programme.desc: Today we are at the Gran Lasco sailing club, located in the very heart of Rome. Its president, Franco Guerrieri will help us achieve our skipper licence so we can go sail on our ship. Then, we travel to Mykonos to try Greek food and wander its streets. Are you coming with us?

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 2
programme.desc: After spending 2 days in Mykonos, where food was at the centre of our attention, we are finally on board and sailing towards Tinos. However, we encounter some problems and have to head back to Mykonos, and we take the time to meet the Mayor before heading back into the water.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this month’s show we will witness the first capsize of an AC75 caught on video as America’s Cup Defenders Emirates Team New Zealand took a tumble off Auckland Harbour. We also dive into the climax of the Brest Atlantiques which saw some of the greatest sailors race the biggest trimarans around the Atlantic. Next, we will update you on SailGP's two new teams for the new season and action from the Grand Finale of the Star Sailors League in the Bahamas. Plenty of end of season world championships have recently taken place - we bring you the action and the new world medallists from Kiteboarding, Windsurfing and three sailing classes.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 2
programme.desc: On this episode we start a new series building up to this summer’s Olympic Games, and we will be looking at the favourites for medals in the 470 and bring you our guide to the sailing venue in Enoshima. Then, the Sydney to Hobart is a highlight of the sailing calendar but the 75th edition was particularly special with the largest fleet in many years. We tell the story of the race and hear from the winners.Later on in The World Sailing Show, the longest intercontinental race of the southern hemisphere gets off to a flying start. We’re on board Maserati multi 70 to hear how Italy’s favourite sailor Giovanni Soldini plans to win the Cape to Rio race.Also, for the first time in its 63 year history the Finn Gold Cup was won by a New Zealander – we find out how he did it.Come join us as we embark into the world of sailing!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode we’ll continue to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. We’ll reveal the new World Champions crowned in Cagliari, Italy at the final event of the series, the 2018 Sardinia Kiteboard Grand Slam.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: As kiteboarding becomes more popular and accessible to the masses, the hopes of many turn towards the Olympic Games. Although shaken, the spirit of the kiteboarders and their steadfast refusal to be defeated is rewarded with a vote of inclusion for the Youth Games in 2018 for the very first time. Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

programme.title: Journey To Giglio
programme.desc: On January of 2012 the Italian cruise ship Costa Concordia sank in shallow waters after striking an underwater rock off Isola del Giglio. Many things remained unclear about this tragedy, so Andi van Zyl is set to discover the truth regarding this incident.Journey to Giglio is an investigative piece on the infamous Costa Concordia tragedy. Andi van Zyl is on the Italian island of Giglio for an exclusive exposé on the shipwreck that shocked the world. She will leave no rock unturned as she digs into what happened the night of the accident and uncovers the disaster’s impact on the local residents and economy.Highlights include exploration of the island and disaster site, and an interview with the man at the helm of the salvage operation, Nick Sloane. Andi sits down with the fellow South African to discuss the delicate process of freeing the wrecked cruise-liner from the reef without spoiling the pristine waters of Giglio Island.Find out the mystery behind the sinking of Costa Concordia on this Journey to Giglio.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Winter Kiting In St Moritz
programme.desc: The ice cold winter of Switzerland, wind, a board and a kite! Welcome to the adventure of winter kiting! Join us as we visit the oldest snowkiting school in the world and admire the action the snowkiting legends put up. All of this on the immense frozen Silvaplana Lake in the middle of the highest peaks of the Swiss Alps.

programme.title: Azores Windsurf Championship 2014
programme.desc: Formula Windsurfing Junior Youth & Masters European Championship - The Euro Cup 2014 was held in the stunningly beautiful Azores.

programme.title: EcoFin Documentary
programme.desc: “We’re just two surfers that decided we could no longer ignore plastic pollution in our oceans.” –Luise Grossmann.Two young innovators created the first sustainable surfboard fin based on ocean-recycled plastics. The founders of FiveOceans give ocean rubbish a new life, using plastic collected from the Indian Ocean, proving it is possible to close the cycle with ocean waste and high quality surf gear.In this stunning documentary, they prove their mission and reveal a transparent value chain of the waste material to design a performance product for surfers. With their background in engineering, the unrivalled story is underlined by surfing, adventure and great personalities as the two friends battle their way to achieve a much higher goal: reducing the plastic that ends up in the oceans they surf.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 5
programme.desc: Today we are in Ericeira in Portugal, Europe's first surfing reserve and a magnet for tourists and surfers from all over the world. While we enjoy the Portuguese sun before heading over to the festival, we leave you a preview of the first film: Otelo Burning, a South African drama that yields a different perspective from professional surfing. Let's dive in!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome back to Screen Heroes, the show that travels the globe and visits the most important surfing festivals in the world! We are in London, and before we find out more about the British surf scene we are going to check out the capital. Are you ready to see what London has in stock for us?

programme.title: OFQUI
programme.desc: The Isthmus of Ofqui, unknown for many and chosen as surf destination by few adventurers.The stretch of land that separates the Pacific Ocean's inland seas, is the only way to make it if you want to surf the shores of Golfo de Penas. Connecting the Taitao Peninsula with the Chilean mainland, Ofqui offers world class waves. This thaw surf film approaches the vast territory of the Patagonia in different ways, this time, centered around Ofqui.Pro surfers will face ice-cold waters in their expedition to surf deathly waves in Ofqui, one of the most unknown locations of the Patagonia and with a microclimate that maximises the upcoming waves.Join them in their adventure to Ofqui here, on Nautical Channel.

One of the most clear signs of the city's connection to the sea is its fish market, here we can find all kind of fishes from the area and get a better sense of the local cuisine. Ghibellina is also setting course to the Aegadian Islands and towards the island of Favignana.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1 Departure

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2 Arrival
programme.desc: The multihulls and monohulls are competing to the extreme in order to arrive in first place at Itajai in Brazil. After the non-stop 5,450 nautical mile course from France to Brazil, the skippers see the bright light ahead and rush towards Brazilian shores. What team will be the ultimate winner of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre? Find out on the 2013 edition of this transatlantic ocean competition.

programme.title: Up the Creek
programme.desc: There's only one boat race in the world where two-man teams blast up southern Australia's Murray River in aluminium dinghies at speeds of over 80kph. This river is not only known for dividing Victoria from New South Wales and for being Australia’s longest river, but also for being full of dangerous obstacles.Up the Creek challenges competing teams to speed up Murray River’s challenging water in a competition like no other. Find out now what will happen in this competition that explores Australia’s nature in depth, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome back to Screen Heroes, the show that travels the globe and visits the most important surfing festivals in the world! programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 1
programme.desc: Ghibellina cruises through to Season 3 of the Voyage of the Ghibellina. As usual, we start our journey in the port of Viareggio. This time however, we will be heading towards southern Italy. Our first stop is Ustica, the small volcanic island to the north of Sicily. We are on a mission to discover the capital of Sicily, Palermo, and explore its rich and diverse history.

programme.title: The Voyage Of Ghibellina - Episode 2
programme.desc: This time, we set sail to see the beautiful city of Trapani, a city that has always been closely connected to the sea. One of the most clear signs of the city's connection to the sea is its fish market, here we can find all kind of fishes from the area and get a better sense of the local cuisine. Ghibellina is also setting course to the Aegadian Islands and towards the island of Favignana.

programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: P1 USA AquaX - Episode 6 Review
programme.desc: The AquaX 2021 USA Championship season might be over, but we are still thrilled with the adrenaline lived these past months. It is time we look back at the most breath-taking moments of the championship, going from Daytona up to St Pete. Are you joining us? Relive the best moments of the 2021 AquaX USA Championship.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode we’ll continue to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. We’ll reveal the new World Champions crowned in Cagliari, Italy at the final event of the series, the 2018 Sardinia Kiteboard Grand Slam.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: As kiteboarding becomes more popular and accessible to the masses, the hopes of many turn towards the Olympic Games. Although shaken, the spirit of the kiteboarders and their steadfast refusal to be defeated is rewarded with a vote of inclusion for the Youth Games in 2018 for the very first time. Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 1
programme.desc: Today we are at the Gran Lasco sailing club, located in the very heart of Rome. Its president, Franco Guerrieri will help us achieve our skipper licence so we can go sail on our ship. Then, we travel to Mykonos to try Greek food and wander its streets. Are you coming with us?

programme.title: Jump On Board - Episode 2
programme.desc: After spending 2 days in Mykonos, where food was at the centre of our attention, we are finally on board and sailing towards Tinos. However, we encounter some problems and have to head back to Mykonos, and we take the time to meet the Mayor before heading back into the water.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1
programme.desc: The 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre is here! Injecting a fresh change, sailors are bound for Martinique and will explore for the first time the West Indies. Be part of the best moments of one of the most demanding transatlantic crossings that promises to be a sensational show as four different boat classes will be giving their all in unpredictable Atlantic waters.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2
programme.desc: Sailors have already been in the water for a couple of days and tiredness is evident on their faces. Even if they compete in pairs, effort is constant and they have to be extremely tactical and careful with the strategic decisions they take on their route. Will Apivia win again in the extremely competitive IMOCA class? Let's find out what has happened this week in the 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre.

programme.title: PRADA Cup - Semi-Final
programme.desc: As INEOS Team UK won the Round Robins, now it is the time for Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli and NYYC American Magic to compete on this semi-final of the 2021 Prada Cup. The first to win four races will become the final contender against the British team in this competition. Who will that be?

programme.title: Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour - Episode 2
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this first episode of Inside Superyachts we meet with the Godfather of Superyacht builders – Feadship Yachts. Established in 1849, this Dutch shipyard is not only the number one in the industry but also the most famous of all superyacht builders, having created masterpieces for the likes of Steve Jobs.From the Netherlands we take a trip down to the ultra-discreet Principality of Monaco, host of the greatest yacht show in the world ‘The Monaco Yacht Show’. Then, we travel thousands of feet below the sea, exploring the vast ocean with Triton Submarines, utilized by some of films greatest names such as film director James Cameron and presenter David Attenborough.

programme.desc: From the Godfather of builders to the Grandaddy of designers we visit the studio of Bannenberg & Rowell to unveil the legend that is the late great Jon Bannenberg. programme.title: PWA World Cup - Tiberias, Israel
programme.desc: Athletes are meeting in Tiberias, Israel, for the PWA World Cup. This first leg of this year's competition will be filled with action after 18 months of inactivity. With winds between 18 and 30 knots, it will truly be a challenge for the world's best windsurf sailors and with this uncertainty in the conditions, we can expect anything to happen in Israel. Don't miss out on the PWA World Cup 2021 in Tiberias that marks the beginning of this year's windsurfing action!

programme.title: Breskell
programme.desc: Master wooden boat builder Olivier D. Huin is back with his crew of Arctic explorers, this time with a much bolder challenge. To take on the legendary Northwest Passages in his hand-built wooden boat; Breskell.In order to succeed the crew will have to brave 5,000 miles of Arctic storms, polar bears and a constantly moving maze of thick arctic sea ice. People have been trying to accomplish this task for the past 500 years, however only a handful of wooden boats have ever successfully made the trip throught this arid landscape.Find out whether if Breskell will be successful in their perilous path or will have to ask for assistance as the wooden boat gets stuck forever in the artic ice. Now available on Nautical Channel.Awards:Finalist – Ottawa Adventure Film Festival 2019. Grand Prize – Adventure Film Festival 2019.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: As kiteboarding becomes more popular and accessible to the masses, the hopes of many turn towards the Olympic Games. Although shaken, the spirit of the kiteboarders and their steadfast refusal to be defeated is rewarded with a vote of inclusion for the Youth Games in 2018 for the very first time. Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

They will battle the elements out on the world's greatest oceans and will experiences the toughest conditions imaginable: from hurricane force winds to squalls that can knock a boat flat. Find out now what will happen in this unique challenge.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3
programme.desc: This month the World Sailing Show focuses on the thrills and spills of a decade of foiling with Sir Ben Ainslie at the INEOS TEAM UK training base in Cagliari, Italy. The British America’s Cup skipper looks ahead to an action-packed year in SailGP and the America’s Cup World Series. Then, we bring you action from the star-studded fleet competing in the RORC Caribbean 600 race - 700 sailors from 37 nations racing 600 miles around 11 islands. A year of Olympic sailing kicked off in Miami with the World Cup Series. We bring you the stories and action from the event that featured seven Olympic classes. Finally, Francis Joyon and his IDEC Sport crew concluded a winter of record-breaking by taking the Hong Kong to London tea clipper route record.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 1
programme.desc: - Array

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode, we are in the TwinTip open Worlds in Hangloose beach, Italy where Florian Gruber has defended his title for the 3rd time! Then, we are set to join the Kite World Series in China’s Weifang and Pingtan where the fastest foilers are ready to set new records in kite foiling. We finish our journey at the final of the series that took place in Cagliari, Italy where Maxim Nocher has been crowned Champion of the series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: IQFOiL International Games - Cádiz
programme.desc: More than 150 athletes from 18 different countries competed in Cadiz for one of the most coveted titles of this class: the second stop of the International Circuit of the IQ Foil class. After the meeting in Lanzarote, some of the best windsurfers in the world meet again in Cadiz to compete in the International Games IQ Foil Cadiz. Enjoy the competition in Cadiz!

programme.title: One with Water
programme.desc: We are connected to the ocean, and if the ocean is not okay, we are not okay. This is the philosophy of free diving record holder Hanli Prinsloo. From a young age, she has been aware of the importance animals and nature have on us, so she has been going underwater to explore her body.Prinsloo is going to take us on a literal breath-taking journey underwater. She believes it is easier to hold our breath than what it is commonly believed, and the underwater world takes us on a new journey of wilderness undiscovered for many. Get ready to dive with her and US Olympic swimmer Peter Marshal in One with Water, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Flavours Of The Sea - Episode 1
programme.desc: We arrive to the port to meet Chef Panos and invite him onboard to try a delicious recipe: linguine with shrimps. The Chef Panos will show us the Greek heritage in the food and a secret ingredient he uses to give his plates his own taste. Then, we go around the port to see whether if we can share this delicious platter with strangers. Then, we meet Chef Nikos to discover a special recipe he has for us.

programme.title: Flavours Of The Sea - Episode 2
programme.desc: In today's episode, we are meeting Chef Dimitri who has a special surprise prepared for us. He will join us on our boat to prepare a unique fish soup, and we are ready to share this delicacy with the people in the port. We will also be meeting Chef Kostas who has his own recipe for pasta with tuna. Come on board and try it out!

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this first episode of What SUP we meet David Brent and go paddleboarding for a chat on the water. He will talk about his experience on the stage before trying out the popular paddleboard yoga with Winny Clarke. We will hopefully learn how to relax on the water and not fall out of our boards too much!

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to the second episode of What SUP. On today's episode, comedian Ryan Maglunob and the band the Elwins will join us in our adventures. Chris first saw Ryan perform live a few months ago, and he was amused throughout the whole set. Let's go take a paddle with Ryan before playing paddle pong and many other challenges!

programme.title: Untouched Waters In Turkmenistan
programme.desc: Welcome to the eastern coast of the Caspian sea. Turkmenistan, Avasa, is known for its desert and not so much for its nautical resort. Nonetheless, Turkmenistan is hosting the PWA World Cup 2014 right here. Nautical Channel host Nikolai Berger explores the untouched waters of the Caspian Sea to discover the first time ever of the PWA Windsurfing World Cup. How will the best windsurfers in the world handle this challenging and unexplored location? Will Antoine Albeau’s brute force triumph again? Find out if the Caspian Sea can become one of the new exciting locations, with just the right wind conditions for this world class in Untouched Waters in Turkmenistan. Only on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Wakeboard World Championship - Japan
programme.desc: Welcome to Japan! The 2018 Nautique WWA Wakeboard World Championship is being disputed in Miyoshi City from the 30th of August to the 2nd of September. The top professional and amateur athletes are ready to take on the best waves and prove their skills to bring home the highest honor in wake.

programme.desc: In this episode, we are in the TwinTip open Worlds in Hangloose beach, Italy where Florian Gruber has defended his title for the 3rd time! Then, we are set to join the Kite World Series in China’s Weifang and Pingtan where the fastest foilers are ready to set new records in kite foiling. We finish our journey at the final of the series that took place in Cagliari, Italy where Maxim Nocher has been crowned Champion of the series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1
programme.desc: The 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre is here! Injecting a fresh change, sailors are bound for Martinique and will explore for the first time the West Indies. Be part of the best moments of one of the most demanding transatlantic crossings that promises to be a sensational show as four different boat classes will be giving their all in unpredictable Atlantic waters.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2
programme.desc: Sailors have already been in the water for a couple of days and tiredness is evident on their faces. Even if they compete in pairs, effort is constant and they have to be extremely tactical and careful with the strategic decisions they take on their route. Will Apivia win again in the extremely competitive IMOCA class? Let's find out what has happened this week in the 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep1 - Kayaking North Lapland, Finland
programme.desc: Ken Whiting is in Lapland North, Finland paddling the Luttojoki River with reindeer, and exploring islands of Lake Inarijarvi in Melker Kayaks.

programme.title: Monaco Yacht Show - 2013
programme.desc: Set in the iconic Port Hercules of the Principality of Monaco since 1991, the MYS is the only place to admire, visit and purchase around 125 extraordinary one-off superyachts built by the world’s most respectful shipyards. Experience the luxury, learn what is trending in the yachting world, and see exclusive test runs of this year's hottest yachts!

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this first episode of What SUP we meet David Brent and go paddleboarding for a chat on the water. He will talk about his experience on the stage before trying out the popular paddleboard yoga with Winny Clarke. We will hopefully learn how to relax on the water and not fall out of our boards too much!

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to the second episode of What SUP. On today's episode, comedian Ryan Maglunob and the band the Elwins will join us in our adventures. Chris first saw Ryan perform live a few months ago, and he was amused throughout the whole set. Let's go take a paddle with Ryan before playing paddle pong and many other challenges!

programme.title: Breskell
programme.desc: Master wooden boat builder Olivier D. Huin is back with his crew of Arctic explorers, this time with a much bolder challenge. To take on the legendary Northwest Passages in his hand-built wooden boat; Breskell.In order to succeed the crew will have to brave 5,000 miles of Arctic storms, polar bears and a constantly moving maze of thick arctic sea ice. People have been trying to accomplish this task for the past 500 years, however only a handful of wooden boats have ever successfully made the trip throught this arid landscape.Find out whether if Breskell will be successful in their perilous path or will have to ask for assistance as the wooden boat gets stuck forever in the artic ice. Now available on Nautical Channel.Awards:Finalist – Ottawa Adventure Film Festival 2019. Grand Prize – Adventure Film Festival 2019.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 2 World Cup Barnaul
programme.desc: Barnaul, in Russia is a city to the west of the Ob River. This is one of the major rivers in Russia and home to the second stage of the Sprint World Cup. Despite the cold windy morning, more than 3000 people have assisted to watch athletes give their all in this competition.Watch the competition at Barnaul that concluded with the 5K challenge.

programme.title: VOR Supremacy
programme.desc: The Volvo Ocean Race sails around 10 cities from all over the world, making it the ultimate test for sailors. Often described as the longest and toughest professional sporting event in the world, it is one of the sport’s big three events, alongside the Olympic Games and America’s Cup.The cannon blast in Alicante sends off the fleet, and once again shakes the sailing world. The veterans finally get their memory back while for the rookies it feels like mission impossible. They share the same obsession for the sea, and many of them have fully dedicated themselves for years, even decades trying to win it.The 2017-18 edition of the Volvo Ocean Race sets sail around the globe. The challenge is full on, and now they are all going rogue.
